result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony A Mitchell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony A Mitchell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang appeared by video for Anthony A Mitchell.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer B. Williams.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony A Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court for Anthony A Mitchell.  Attorney Amanda Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson.

Case in court for a status conference.  State informs that this matter should be re-tabbed to Branch 36, Judge Crivello.  Court re-tabbed the matter and scheduled a preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch PE, Rm 146 CJF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Manuel Galang

Defendant Anthony A Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Alexandria Carlson.  Attorney Tom Reed appears as friend of the court.

Case in court for a State v. Lee hearing.  State Public Defender's Office has not yet appointed counsel for Mr. Mitchell.  Attorney Reed gives explanation to the court.  Court finds good cause to allow the SPD's office time to continue to find an attorney to appoint.  Court scheduled a status of counsel date and ordered Attorney Reed to appear at the next court date if no appointment is made.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant Anthony A Mitchell not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony A Mitchell not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony A Mitchell not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Laura R J
Macy's  the entire Mall property, including the parking lots and structures
Kyle L
Robert D S
Kinya S

Defendant Anthony A Mitchell in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Anthony A Mitchell in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony A Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
